bibl.title: Greeks or Copts?: Documentary and Other Evidence for Artistic Patronage during the Late Roman and Early Byzantine Periods at Herakleopolis Magna and Oxyrhynchos, Egypt.
bibl.note: The documentary papyri and the archaeological evidence indicate that the commissioners of the niched tombs were the wealthier, educated pagans and Christians who shared a common Greek or Hellenized outlook.

bibl.title: Life in a Multi-Cultural Society: Egypt from Cambyses to Constantine and Beyond

bibl.seg: THOMAS Thelma K., Greeks or Copts?: Documentary and Other Evidence for Artistic Patronage during the Late Roman and Early Byzantine Periods at Herakleopolis Magna and Oxyrhynchos, Egypt.
Janet H. JOHNSON (Ed.), Life in a Multi-Cultural Society: Egypt from Cambyses to Constantine and Beyond = SAOC. 51 (Chicago, 1992) pp. 317-322, 2 pll.

The documentary papyri and the archaeological evidence indicate that the commissioners of the niched tombs were the wealthier, educated pagans and Christians who shared a common Greek or Hellenized outlook.
